group_1.textLeft: My script caused today's incident...?

group_1.textRight: Yes.

group_1.textLeft: That's not... I don't remember using any strange@magic, though.

group_1.textRight: Perhaps it's been happening unconsciously?@You see, your magic...
I suppose you could call it "kotodama". A force that@controls people via the words you communicate.

group_1.textLeft: Kotodama...

group_1.textRight: It bears some similarities to my magic...
...in that it manifests a story based upon a rough@outline.
You know, I've got a hunch about that too...
There were a few moments during production where@I felt this strange weight behind what Kira said.
Mihono, what do you say to casting Komachi in the@lead role?
I'd like to be a stagehand, actually.
And don't you think your small frame would make@for a more striking contrast, Mihono?

group_1.textLeft: [chara:304001:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]You mean those came true because I said them?!

group_1.textRight: Does that mean that if Temari says something,@people will obey her?

group_1.textLeft: That can't be...
I can't remember any time when something like@THAT happened.

group_1.textRight: Naturally, it's impossible for you to control the@people of the world at will.
Any synopsis that exceeds the limit of your magical@ability cannot come true.

group_1.textLeft: ...I see. This whole movie incident only involved@changing a few people's actions at most, after all.

group_1.textRight: Additionally, in exchange for consuming only a small@amount of magic energy...
Your magic seems to activate involuntarilyâ€” that is,@at an extremely low probability in very rare cases.

group_1.textLeft: *Sigh*...@So it's impossible to control, in short?
[chara:304001:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...Doesn't this strike you as a BIT risky? I'll have to@second-guess everything I say!

group_1.textRight: And bad stuff could happen if you accidentally say@the wrong thing, right?

group_1.textLeft: Plus, I can't even use it at will. Sounds like nothing@but downsides, honestly.

group_1.textRight: That may be, but I'd strongly caution you against@trying to control it by force.
In my case, I was able to manifest whatever story@I wanted...
But I had to pay an enormous price in return.
...You can see the result just by looking at me.

group_1.textLeft: Why would this happen...?

group_1.textRight: Well, many girls become able to use magic related@to the content of their wish...
What was it in your case?

group_1.textLeft: My wish was...

group_1.narration: "I want the words I weave to reach somebody's heart."

group_1.textRight: ...I see. That's a wonderful wish. As a fellow author,@I can quite strongly relate.
Since your contract was completed, Kyubey certainly@ought to grant that wish.
Without a doubt, your works will reach the readers@they were ultimately meant to.

group_1.textLeft: ...And my "kotodama" magic is a byproduct of that?

group_1.textRight: Yes... You move people's hearts with the words you@arrange. That seems to be your ability.

group_1.textLeft: But... how am I supposed to write ANY plays or@novels at this rate? It'd be too dangerous.

group_1.textRight: | There's no need to worry about that.@The things happening right now... |
| Are because "all three of you" were filming a@movie based on "real events." |
She's right.
Unless you were writing a story about real,@currently-living people...
...there would be no way for your "kotodama"@power to take effect.

group_1.textLeft: ...True.@There'd be no actual people who it could control.

group_1.textRight: It's just that in this case, there was a very particular@set of circumstances.

group_1.narration: Nemu Hiiragi's theory was as follows.
Due to Mihono's "stage direction," the actors@became fully immersed in the personae of their roles.
Due to Komachi's "restoration," those characters'@personae were reconstructed in the present day.
And due to my "kotodama," those resurrected characters@are following the script I wrote about them...

group_1.textRight: If any one of you hadn't been involved, this situation@wouldn't have arisen.
Additionally, because each of your abilities fit@together with the others so well...
The effects of your magic were all greatly enhanced.

group_1.textLeft: I see... so that's what you meant by our magic@interacting.

group_1.textRight: Remember the performances everyone gave during@filming?
They replicated your script with terrifying precision.
In retrospect, the synergy between you three made@for a dangerously accurate reenactment...

group_1.textLeft: ...I'm really glad we didn't bring the knife on set.

group_1.textRight: Y-yeah...

group_1.textLeft: Hey, Nemu. Why is this affecting things outside of@the movie?

group_1.textRight: It's a side effect.
Their magic was being used for the sake of the@film's production...
But its effects didn't conveniently deactivate when@the camera wasn't rolling.
Then, today, several actors coincidentally met each@other near the Coordinator's shop...
And as a result of the "stage direction" and@"kotodama" magic activating...
An incident similar to the film occurred.

group_1.textLeft: Ah, I see...
I did get the sense that it was a particularly rough@recreation of the script.
That was because it was only a spontaneous@"side effect," I take it?

group_1.textRight: I believe so. We're quite far away from the film set,@too...
It hardly bears comparison to the precision they@displayed during filming.

group_1.textLeft: And as for why Kanagi and I got pulled in despite@having nothing to do with the film...
I suppose that was the "stage direction" magic?

group_1.textRight: Most likely.
One can surmise that whoever was close by, and had@a suitably equivalent relationship with the actors...
Was chosen as an "unnamed extra" of sorts.

group_1.textLeft: ...Sounds complicated.

group_1.textRight: Quite. I simplified a lot of it for my explanation@just now.
But since there's several types of magic at work,@it's difficult to strictly separate them.
And finally... there's one thing that worries me@above all else.
Based on today's incident, there's a high likelihood@that the FOLLOWING incident will also occur.

group_1.textLeft: According to the script, Ruri's disappearance comes@next. Followed by...
Her murder-suicide with Tsukihiko?!

group_1.textRight: Huh?!

group_1.textLeft: Then we'd better keep a really close eye on Seira...!

group_1.textRight: ...Where's Mihono right now?

group_1.textLeft: She ought to be on the sofa in the room nextâ€”@huh?
I know I saw her there when Mikura woke up...

group_1.textRight: Wha?
I can't remember all that clearly, but...@I guess I must not have noticed her?

group_1.textLeft: Don't tell me...!

group_1.textRight: Mihono's...

group_1.textLeft: ...disappeared?
